choices.E: Select a Content Library, click Related Objects tab and click Templates.
choices.D: In the vSphere Web Client navigator, select vCenter Inventory Lists > Content Libraries.
choices.A: Right-click a VM Template and select New VM from This Template.
choices.B: In the vSphere Web Client navigator, select vCenter Inventory Lists > VM templates in Folders.
choices.C: Using vSphere Host client, select vCenter Inventory Lists > Content Libraries.

questions.question_text: Which three steps deploy a virtual machine from a VM Template in the Content Library? (Choose three.)

discussion.content: ADE is correct. Passed 07 dec 20 with 500/500

c: is not correct , d: is correct : It is important to know that the VMware Host Client is different from the vSphere Web Client, regardless of their similar user interfaces. You use the vSphere Web Client to connect to vCenter Server and manage multiple ESXi hosts, whereas you use the VMware Host Client to manage a single ESXi host.
A C D or A D E ?

B is incorrect, It will show templates not from Content Library
C is incorrect. a Host Client can't view Content Library 
D will not show Content Libraries from Inventory Lists

as per https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.5/com.vmware.vsphere.vm_admin.doc/GUID-CBAFA27A-F888-4121-9DC6-53B01CB358DE.html

You can jump from Home> Content Libraries then select the Location

Did they even check D?
But for the test, ADE

C is worng, vSphere Host Client does not access Content Library
correct answers are ADE

I am new to this forum, who corrects these questions here ?!
But "click Related Objects tab " , where is this tab? I can't find any tab with his name neither web client nor client. Then ACD for me is correct

comments.content:
I think, that's because sometime ago vmware got rid of the "related objects" completely and nowadays they show the name of the special object directly. see link: 
https://blogs.vmware.com/vsphere/files/2016/11/RelItems-combined.png 

so it's possible, that the same is true for content libraries.
You cannot create Content libraries without vcenter. you cannot create Content libraries in standalone esxi hosts from vsphere host client. So, the possible answer will be a, b, e

discussion.content: with ACD you don't select a content library, and why the vsphere host client?

questions.question_text: When trying to export the vApp to the OVF, the option is grayed out. What solution allows for the export of a vApp?

discussion.content:
This is answer is correct.
Prerequisites
Power off the virtual machine or vApp.
Required privilege: vApp.Export

choices.C: Change the portgroup where the VMs are connected to.
choices.B: Logout of the vSphere Client and use the vSphere WebClient.
choices.A: The vApp is marked as Non-Exportable.

discussion.content: vicfg-ntp is not exist on esxi 6.7

comments.content:
https://vdc-download.vmware.com/vmwb-repository/dcr-public/24be7af7-d9cd-48d9-bab8-8c91614be19d/0ca33108-8017-4b40-86b9-f066456894ea/vsphere-esxi-vcenter-server-67-command-line-interface-concepts-examples-guide.pdf 
according to this doc still exist in 6.7

questions.question_text: Which three methods can a vSphere administrator use to automatically synchronize time on a ESXi host? (Choose three.)

choices.A: Log in to the VMware Host Client, navigate to Host > Manage > Time & date and click Edit settings.
choices.C: Select the host in the vSphere Web Client, navigate to Configure > System > Time Configuration and click the Edit button.
choices.B: Configure the VMware Tools time synchronization.
choices.E: Use the esxcli hardware clock get command in the ESXi Shell.

questions.question_text: Which two formats are supported for exporting a VM to a storage media? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: Answer is correct. Only valid answers is B and C. EXE and ISO are not valid options for exports within vCenter

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true using Resource Pools? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Resource Pools compartmentalize all resources in a datacenter.
choices.A: Resource Pools require vSphere DRS to be enabled.
choices.B: Resource Pools compartmentalize all resource in a cluster.
choices.D: Resource Pools require vSphere HA to be enabled.
